Amazing Experience. Amazing cenotes, lots of wildlife - loved swimming in these surroundings.It was an experience I'd never forget and got some amazing photographs.
Love it. Great but amount of time here not enough. An hour and a half is not enough time to have lunch and enjoy the cenote. Loved jumping in from top level!!!!!
Long day, but enjoyed it. Enjoyed it....long day. Cenote was awesome. Make sure you bring or wear your suits. We were not told about the denote visit until we where I'mN the bus.

Great for diving and a good snorkel too. went here to snorkel, just caught the local bus and got dropped off, beautiful area, lots of nature in the jungle and a good snorkel too, if you are a scuba diver it is a must!

Kin - Ha Cenote / Zip line / 4 wheeler. So here we are on the beach at our resort and we get approached by a young man named Benjamin who starts his sales pitch with us regarding all the tours his company provides and how much money we will save by going through them instead of through the hotel. Last year we had done expeditions through the hotel and they were nice and you paid for it, however they were all day long, and this trip was around 4 hours. After thinking it over and realizing how much we could potentially save financially and how it was only 4 hours long we decided to go for it! The van picked us up at 9:00 am, not the best van, not the worst, but to be expected, we paid slightly more for a private tour - did not have to pick up anyone else from other resorts worth it in my opinion. We traveled for about 30 minutes, switched vehicles when we got to a rough dirt road, hoped in the 4 door pick up truck (new truck) traveled another few miles and we were at our destination. This place is in the middle of the jungle for real, super cool very laid back environment. They got right to business signing waivers, taking money, explaining the rules, gave us a locker to put our things in (change of clothes, phones, money, etc) Before we knew it we were on our 4 wheelers heading down the rough dirt road which was pretty fun, they go over the operation of the 4 wheelers thoroughly and you get a helmet and goggles and a life vest (for cenote). After about 15-20 minutes of cruising through dirt roads and jungle we got to the cenote. This place was really cool its like a big crater in the earth, water was very clear and clean, 2 zip lines, 4 or 5 different platforms (cliff jumping) to jump from. The highest is 55 feet, we did the 45 footer and that was awesome! The zip lines were a lot of fun as well, we had a group of about 10 of us and the only people that did the zip lines and cliffs was our party and 2 others so we could just keep jumping and zip lining without waiting. We were there for about 45 minutes, then back on the 4 wheelers and back to the base camp destination were we started. They took our lunch order (burger, fries, and water - other options too, watch out for the HOT sauce it is HOT and delicious if you like that stuff) While we waited we walked the grounds and went to another cenote, this one was basically completely under ground really cool like a cave with stilagtites or stilagmites, water was cold (under ground) theres a narrow slot that you can jump (15-20 foot) through to get down or you can take the stairway, we opted for the jump which was awesome. Got some cool photos down there, then the group got together we took a short walk around the grounds and got to the next zip lines from the tree tops. There is 2 zip lines there both pretty long and fun. Afterwards lunch was ready and delicious! They have a photographer that follows you on your journey and at the very end there is an area where he shows you your personal photos that you can purchase, or you can purchase a DVD with all your photos on it for $40.00 we opted for that as he took some great action shots. Our guide was Remmy and he was very cool, very laid back, very positive, and also very informative. No complaints at all from this party, it was myself, my girlfriend, and her teen-age daughter and we all had a blast!!! Highly recommended!! Thanks Kin-Ha keep up the great work!

One of the most exiliterating experiences I have ever had!. This underground cenote is amazing! At first, I was scared to death to walk down the stairs into the dark unknown. Once I got to the bottom of the stairs, I was in awe of the beauty of the cenote. The water is chilly but feels amazing in a hot day. The water is clear but it is super scary to jump in initially. After about 5 minutes, I didn't want to leave!I highly recommend this spot. Especially after a visit to the Coba Ruins which is right down the road.

Once in a Lifetime Experience!. If you are not afraid of water or heights, you have to dive into one of the many "Cenotes" in Mexico! It is like "Cliff Diving" but without the worries of poor timing! LOL!

family run and owned...quiet and un touristy. the water was clear and cold...many divers in the tunnels. family style setting..we went in with a guide and that made us feel safe and confident and we all enjoyed the extra details.

Amazing Day!. I had an amazing day visiting this place! Our tour guide Mundo made sure we had fun all day long. He is a great guide! He is patient and funny and was really going out of his way to make sure we had a great day. This place is really more than I expected and it really was awesome. I highly recommend you visiting this place and asking for Mundo Carvallo as your guide.

One of the prettiest cenotes!. Cool, sparkling fresh water in the heart of the steamy jungle: you can easily see why cenotes were sacred to the Maya people.This is one of my favorites for snorkeling or SCUBA. Area is well-maintained, safe, & secure. Paths easy for strolling & carrying heavy gear.Cool cave formations, flowering lily pads, colorful fish, & baby turtles. Just perfect!

Great cool down after Itza. This was a welcome relief after a long trip to Itza, clean changing/toilet shower areas and although a bit slippy the stairs allow you easy access to the water. Several viewing areas for non swimmers to take photos or simply relax with a drink/ice cream etcNever seemed busy whilst we were there, respect their rules and shower first to protect a natural wonder

What an amazing history.. Just fabulous, so glad we went, the history of this site is just amazing, not really suitable for children so we left daughter, son in law and granddaughter at hotel, but husband and I just loved it even though it's so hot and tiring, not to be missed.

Three in one!. This cenote is actually multiple cenotes all in one place. The paths throughout are well-maintanied and easy to walk, with clear signs to help you get around, because it is a pretty big place overall.There is an "open" cenote, which is wide and sunny, surrounded by tropical foliage, and full of beautiful fish and underwater flora. It is perfect for snorkeling or just lazily swimming in the cool refreshing water. There is a small set of wooden steps to help you in if you do not want to just jump- this was good for our six-year-old who was a bit timid. Some areas are deep and it is amazing to just float along and look through the crystal clear water and see the rugged bottom.There is a "closed" cenote. It is like a cave tunnel and you can swim from one end to the other. It was fascinating. Of course, because there is no sun to warn the water, this cenote is pretty chilly, so you will probably not linger in the water too long. It is fun though, and a bit thrilling as you swim through the dark water with the stone roof over you. I will admit, I was a bit scared, but that is because I have a fear of the dark. Silly me... :)There is a sacred cenote that you are not allowed to swim in, but is so lovely and peaceful It is kind of underground, but not completely, and there are lots of openings in the ceiling of the cenote. The tree roots that have made their way through the limestone rock and are trailing down to the water and earth below are incredible to see. The water in this is so still and so blue. It does feel like a magical place.I have visited other cenotes (Cenote Azul is another one I like a lot), but this one beats them all! GO!!!! Take your snorkel gear. You will love it!!!

Great FUN!. We rolled up to this off the beaten path cenote by chance but are very glad we did. Was very affordable- If I recall we paid about $25/person and that included snorkel gear and the two zip lines on the property. One cenote was under a cave and didnt have many fish but amazing rock formations to swim underneath. The other cenote had much more sunshine and a lot of marine life. Our guy was fun and stayed with us the entire time. We had a very inexperienced group and only snorkeled but always felt as our guide was with us and keeping an eye on us. The zip lines both went over water and had great views. Also for lunch, the empenadas were basically a $1 each and were amazing. Overall no complaints from anyone in our group and a great time was had by all. Thanks again!!

So refreshing!. My partner dove here while I snorkelled, it was a lot of fun. We booked through ProDive, dive master, Baptiste was very knowledgeable. My guide was Fernando, he was very nice and friendly. I loved the cenotes, esp where it was SO hot there in the jungle.

What a hidden gem!!. We asked a local driver to take us to a cenote where we could float alone and that wasn't crowded so he took us here. We were greeted cheerfully and were the only ones there at 9AM on a Sunday! It only cost us 500 pesos to get in as well. We didn't have to wear life vests, helmets or go with a tour guide. We found the cave cenote and jumped in. The water GLOWED topaz blue - it was like swimming in a gemstone! There was absolutely no one there and we had the place to ourselves for a while.I am sure that it's probably not for everyone. There are stairs and walking, and like I said, the float vest was optional (which we loved). I also recommend Carlos Aguilar to drive you if you detest busses of tourists like we do! 998-844-81 67 -- he was amazing.

Refreshing!. We did these cenotes after a morning swim at Akumal. The cenotes are beautiful, and were refreshing when you jumped in to swim! Would recommend these for half a day excursion to anyone to experience them!

Cliff diving. This was an awesome experience to not only see but to experience the swimming in a Cenote and diving off the cliffs, actually they don't like you diving and want you,to enter the water feet first ....oppps
Cave scuba diving. Very cool to dive in enclosed area with no waves or current. Not much marine life but the cave formations make it a bucket list to-do item
Quite and Beautiful. A quiet cenote with beautiful diving that feels off the beaten track. I had some homemade empanadas for lunch and they were tasty! Not very touristy feeling at all.

Great value for self guided visit. Walked (ran really- be careful!) across highway from Barcello. Looking for cristalino cenote and came across chiken ha first. Was right next to kanten chi cenote which is about 800 pesos for guided tour. We had a group of 11 and negotiated with the guy in the booth to get in for 200 pesos instead of 250 each. Walked 20 min down dirt road and came to the facility. Showers and lockers provided. 3 cenotes

Peaceful and charming. 3 cenotes, one open with a wide range of fish and surrounded with plants and birdchirping, one cave with lot of"spa fish", and one just for take pictures. Long distance on foot, but worth to see it. Not so many people, entrance fee is ok, 200 pesos / p. Showers, toalettes were clean and nice designed.

Beautiful Cenotes!. There were 3 total Cenotes here 2 to swim in and 1 to look at. It was off the beaten path, so there was not a lot of other people there. I would highly recommend it if you have the time.

Better than most Cenotes in Mexico. Most cenotes you have to trek down flights of stair or scuba dive them. And then there are the masses of people that swim in and "go" in the cenotes. UHG! the smell is usually sooo bad however, this one was nice and wasn't too awful for a germ freak like myself. I would recommend going in off season and PLEASE shower before entering, the water is cold anyway Just bite the bullet.

Interesting refreshing experience. This is the first time for me visiting a cenote and it was very refreshing. This is on private land and run by family members so it is a b&b of cenote I guess. We were take to this cenote as part of our excursion.There are several under ground river or pools of water and the main one where one can swim from one to the other side is amazing. Water is refreshing and the sun beam dances as it strikes the clear cool liquid. We saw divers scuba diving and apparently it is very deep, and the divers are cave diving trying to connect the cenotes. A great place to spend the morning or the afternoon and it is easy to get to just past Playa del Carmen on the way to Tulum.

Another Adventure!. Scuba Diving the cenotes is an unforgettable adventure. One thing is for sure, each and every cenote is very different from the next and very unique. This particular cenote is no different, it is big in area with very large rock and quite a varied fossil deposits, in contrast to the Dos Ojos/Bat Cave cenote which is fascinating with its stalactites, etc.Make sure to visit with a reputable dive company and you will not be disappointed. Cenote diving is typically a 2 tank dive, each on a different route. This cenote has caves as well but that is a completely different dive adventure that requires special certification/training.

Unexpected Photos & Fun..... I can't tell you how many times I've drove by this place and never saw the sign, Ugh, I'm ashamed. Haha.... We stopped in this January and did the tour and this place is Beautiful. You can tell they put ALOT of effort into the grounds. You can start by looing into a small gift shop or having a get together at their shelter. Then you may walk a short distance to an open pit style Cenote and take a swim or Dive here. There is a second Cave Cenote for the same a little further, both quiet and serenly beautiful. Jungle canopy is thick, so dont NOT go if there is some rain. NOTE: (I prefer visiting Cenotes' in the rain, usually You can have the place to yourself)The third is a "Mayan Ritual" Cave Cenote that is only for walking and photos. This is where is got a little paranormal. None of the photos of my wife would take. Me and my friends photos (taken as tests) were clear and normal. I will post the photos here and you tell me what you think....Skulls and mist on a clear and sunny day, An arm of "pure light" touching my wifes face in another. Wow!!!!The folks who run this place are polite and curtious, grounds are clean and presentable. Plenty of parking and paths are smooth to travel for the most part....I WILL be back....Tell em', "Chicago Joe" sent You....

Fantastic dive in Chikin Ha cenote. We had a great diving experience in this cenote, getting in the water in Chikin Ha, reaching through the tunnels the rainbow cenote (beautiful) and coming back. We did two exploration dives, amazing lights, incredible halocline experience and nice galleries.I definitively recommend it!

Didn't have an experience like previous posters. I don't know what happened at this Cenote, but our experience was terrible. We were brought here by a private tour guy name George who insisted this is the best cenote in the area. I pressed him to stop here at the beginning of the day but he pushed back saying the water is to cold at 10 in the morning. I explained to him that this isn't my first rodeo, and all cenotes are cold regardless of time of day. So he took us to Akumal first and then to the cenote. I should have known better when we pulled in and the driver to a wink and a smile from the guy in the booth at the entrance. He opened the doors to the van and basically said see you in 3 hours. We were never told that you should buy the expensive option for the best experience, so we bought the basic tour for $25 USD. The basic tour was, well, basic. Walk yourself to the cenotes and have at it. The first one looked like a swamp and when I told the group to jump in, they thought I was nuts. The second one was nice, but just a basic pool of water under a partial cave. The third one had a layer of white scum over it, so nobody dared enter. We were there for a total of 40 minutes. When we got back to the van, George was really surprised to see us and wasn't happy when I told him to take us back to Akumal so we could hang out at La Buena Vida. Funny thing is there was a brochure for Kantun-Chi cenote which is right next door. It looked awesome, and I would say worth a shot before trying the frickin Chikin.....

fun. there are 3 cenote here one was a little dark I found it a little freaky but it was very safe our guide Teamara was very informative one was a sacred place of the Maya there was a alter and sacred objects set out very cool don't touch there was a tradicial wedding going on everybody in white felt bad walking inon the bride's happy day but she never quit smileing so beautiful. the last cenote was quite shallow and loaded with fish and tiny little turtles great day $68 us each and they do the driving and feed you have fun!

Interesting time. Well worth it. Enjoyed the swimming and the artifacts that were presented. Hopefully the locals might enjoy some of the profits as they are in dire need of more higher standards of living. Enjoyed the crystal clear cool waters. A little cool to get in, but once you are there. Fantastic.
Great fun :). Wow I liked the look of it huge and fresh. However I disliked the temperature of water it was very cold.
two tank dive there. Good equipment and dive master---very fun dive, and a must do if you scuba. We were charged $220 per diver and it was well worth it.
Great Dip. This was included as part of a different tour. I wouldn't have thought to go on my own but was glad I did. It was really refreshing and interesting. Would do it again in a heart beat.

No fear. This was my first time in a cenote its really nice and the water is so clear. We went into 2 different caves and swam around with Paco our guide who also happened to be quite attractive. We did rappel into the cave, I liked that and was not frightened at all like some of the men and women. We zip lined into the water but when you do this water goes up your nose so be prepared. After that there was 2 zip lines thru the forest you have to climb very high towers which are almost vertical so if you are not in good shape don't do it. I am a 44 year old and had no problem at all. There was a lunch at the farm it was traditional Mayan food which was a bit bland but fine. The juice was from flowers and yummy. After that we went to Tulum and saw the ruins and beach and there was some tourist flea market type things along the park road. The water was a bit rough there and I did not go in very far. Lots of stairs to go down to the beach so its not good for people with mobility issues.
Chikin Ha and swimming with turtles. Went to this place with my Son. We had a great time the tour guide was excellent, well informed with its history. I recommend it to everyone.

FUN!!. We went with Sea Blue travel - great price, lots of experience, great with our children, delicious lunch. We ziplined in the jungle, drove ATVs through the jungle to 2 Cenotes where we were able to swim and dive, so much fun and such great guides and people!!
Great Cenote Dive. This was an amazing dive with great rock formations. Martin from Cenote Xperience in Playa was a great Dive Master.

Very Nice. We took the Chikin Ha tour from Sandos Playacar and was amazed at the clarity of the water of the cenotes. We took every opportunity to snorkel in each the cenotes. Scuba divers were 50 ft below us and we could see them clear as a bell. This is a great place to visit and see cavern type cenotes.

Mysterious paradise. While at one of our a' la carte dinners at the Barcelo' we met another couple from Port Alberni (small world). Mike and Emily have been coming to the Barcelo' for nine years and told us of this Cenote directly across from the entrance to the Barcelo' Resorts.We spent the next day exploring and snorkelling this amazing Cenote. Crystal clear water, lots of depth and the lagoon was breathtaking!Thank you so much Mike and Emily for making our vacation a memorable one!See you back home.Cheers,Glenn & Maria

Interesting. Good information from the guide.intersting data regarding the Mayan culture. Disliked that the pyramid was closed to climbing.Also, did not feel vendors were allowed on the path in the grounds attempting to sell their wares.

excellent place to swim!. I loved it was a great experience, I love everything but the water felt cold!. amazing people, great suvenirs, great views, the people who work there was very helpful and nice, I really enjoyed!

Peaceful setting, beautiful scenery. Peaceful afternoon at the cenote Chikin Ha. It is located a short distance from Puerto Aventuras. Traveled by a colectivo to the location and then walked about 15 minutes to the entrance. Very interesting cenote and not very crowded - a great place to spend the afternoon. Arrived around 12:15 and stayed for about 2 hours exploring the various cenotes.
Hidden gem in the mayan jungle. Spectacular cenotes, peaceful environment and fantastic service make this eco-park a great place to spend a day in the mayan riviera

Peaceful.... These cenotes are peaceful, not too over crowded and so clear. There are three main cenotes, all different and each one has its own unique attraction. The first cenote you come to is best for fish and snorkelling. The second one is great for scuba diving. The third one has fossils on the walls. Beautiful.
Quite and Beautiful. I loved the underground river and the main CENOTE. The kids love to dive on the Cenotes. It's very calm and it's really well maintained.
The best. I went to several cenotes and this one was the best for me you have to try it.Take moskito off products.

Not as good as Dos Ojos but quieter. I enjoyed Chikin Ha cenote a lot. It's very close to Playa del Carmen so you can do it in an afternoon or morning, doesn't need to take the whole day. There are three cenotes all within walking distance so you get to see a small selection, and each one has its own character. Definitely worth a visit.
Cavern Diving. Pro Dive was a very good operator, dive guides were very safe, excellent briefings and cavern diving was an amazing experiance.

awesome adventure. Gives you an opportunity to see some beautiful areas that made the Myan villages so attractive to live work & understand their style of life. Its not indebth, boring, and yes I would have liked more time but honestly we did a lot and I recommend the opportunity to enjoy more then the standard Pool, beach atmosphere at the resorts.
Great dive. This is a must for scuba divers it's not like a ocean dive . It was a super day that not every body will get to see. Just do it

Skip this one,. This is a Xenote that is natural, small, not that much there. It has one cave that you swim in for 10 minutes and one open air that you get 10 minutes in. It is packaged with a Turtle swim package at Akumal. Go with one of the better Xenote/jungle entertainment packages and a separate snorkel trip

This place was awesome!. Lorenzo was our guide on this tour and he was an terrific guide. The zip lining into the water was so breathtaking. My wife and I had a great time on the ATV's and during the ride we switched into our bathing suits and took the plunge.
Cool. A lovely cool swim after walking in the jungle . But you need to be aware there is nowhere to get changed after your swim .

Lovely Place to visit. Very interesting place to visit. We went on a tour and had an English guide who was very good. We learnt alot about the Myan culture. The buildings are incredible, so very precise.
Underground underwater caves. Very pretty stalagtites and stalagmites, wish I had had a camera! Deep in the jungle, enjoyed this swimming tour!

Gorgeous!. Once you arrive, you pay $25 a person to enter. You have to shower off before going in the water, getting rid of sunscreen, bug spray and other oils. Don't want to upset the delicate ecosystem within the cenote! The mosquitoes were awful but if you stay in the water, you'll be okay. I would recommend wearing wet socks, as there are rocks and such. It kind of freaked me out how clear the water was! Beautiful view of tiny fish and a couple of birds in the trees. Be sure to take a towel,water and a camera. They do provide lockers, life jackets and tubes.

Watch out for the Mosquitoes. A great trip but it was ruined by the amount of mosquitoe bites we recieved to the point that it was hard to pay attention to our guide due to continuously fighting the insects.
swim. Very cool to see. Probably good idea to bring towel and change of clothes as this is inside a cave not out on a beach
Amazing crystal clear water. If you're used to ocean diving, this is a slight change since cenotes are basically fresh water. Did two great dives.

If you get a chance to dive -- do it. Easily accessible -- walk down to water with dive tanks on. Incredible experience, did with Dressel divers. What an amazing opportunity to experience cavern diving,
So fun. Amazing trip snorkeled kayak zip lined and rappelled the guide was very knowledgeable and they feed us twice

Beautiful natural place. Chikin Ha was not something my partner and I would have chosen to do whilst we were on holiday, but it came as part of a turtle snorkelling tour booked through our Thomas Cook rep. The Cenote is owned by a family who look after it really well. There is plenty of plants and wildlife to look at as you move between the various cenotes.Our excursion gave us the chance to snorkel in two of them and view another. The first swimmable was in a cave. The water was freezing, but the sight of all the limestone rock both above and below the water was amazing. The second was like an underground garden. Beautiful flowers and loads of fish and turtles, dragonflies, butterflies, etc.It's such a peaceful place and looks as though it is never too busy. It was nice to find something new to enjoy that I would never have considered anyway. If cenotes is your thing, then I definitely reccomend Chikin Ha due to it's variety of cenotes.

Chikin Ha Cenote Tour. The Chikin Ha cenote excursion was excellent. The tour was not "rushed" like some can be. It was very relaxing, beautiful and informative. Swimming in the below ground cenote was a very memorable experience. Un-wordly clear water. So clear that fellow swimmers almost appeared to be floatin in the air on my GoPro video. The above ground pool was very picturesque as well. I highly recommend this trip.

Nice Day. Dove at Cenote Chicken Ha with Dive Mike dive shop in Playa del Carmen (see separate review). This is my second Cenote dive (Choc Mal was first). This is a beautiful cenote dive, lots of caverns, and the facilities at the dive site are great and clean. Good dive site.
Very nice!. Had a great tour guide thru this cenote, plus snorkeling with the sea turtles. Well worth the money.
Awesome. Our young adult children jumped from a high platform into the water. The view from the bottom looking up makes you realize how breathtaking Mother Earth is.
Cold water. I don't swim but my family does. Dipped myself in the cenote and my family went swimming. Great experience.

Nice cenote. Really nice and well-maintained cenote, worth visiting. We visited them through Ocean Tours, it was really nice experience to snorkel and get to know more cultural background about cenotes.

Great for cave diver training. I am local resident and take all my cave diver candidates/clients to various cenotes during the week long (and intensive) scuba diving training. Chikin Ha and X'Tabay are the two cenotes on the property and boost an array of wild life and fauna, typical to the Mayan jungle.Very pleasant staff and if I recall, visitors on a tour can enjoy local food too, fresh from the Mayan stove.I highly recommend visiting Chikin Ha cenote.
Nice but no thanks. Is nice to see but lots of people and is just jumping and getting out and jumping againNice to see but there are plenty of cenotes to chose

must do - take a dip !. When entering the scene it was already mesmerising. The swim was better than expected though cold 19C. Do it, it's a experience worth it, even for 15 min don't let it pass, the food by the way and the service was great as well.
Cenote awesome. jaw droppinly beautiful, amazing although I have been before and note that there are now restaurants and gift shops situated there,
Refreshing. Love the cool refreshing water and a day of sun and sand. Lovely to just relax in the cool very clear deep cenote and chill. In the jungle and so quiet and tranquil.

AMAZING....100%. Five of us went through Olympus Tours and had a truly amazing time. We snorkeled in the underground cenote first and then headed along the path to the one in the open still with time for the sunlight to illuminate underwater. Lunch after was simple yet delicious. We were served an empanada, banana, plenty of water, cake, granola bar and a lollipop - haha. Well, after two hours of snorkeling we devoured it all. The blue cichlid fish in the open air cenote were electric blue...so cool! Be sure to ask about the dog with scratches on his face - from a jaguar fight!

Amazing cenote. The mosquitos outside the cenote were pretty fierce but the cenote was amazing. Our guide (Manual from Bahia divers) took us through twice along different routes, Gliding over amazing bleached pieces of limestone which looked like giant dinosaur vertebrae was sensational. Ask to dive it.

Good time. We visited these cenotes as part of a 1/2 day trip. Just a few notes for people. Snorkle in the open cenote first. Because it gets direct sunlight, plants and such grow in the water. If you save that one for last, you will want to shower off. BUT, if you snorkle in the larger cave cenote last, you can kind of rinse off in it. Also, the water is colder than you might expect but it will help reduce the itching and swelling of the mosquito bites you are sure to get while walking the paths! :)
Great cenote to dive. There are so many great cenotes in the Playa area. This is one of them. Very beautiful grounds also.

Fun for a quick visit. I liked the fact of what it is and that you can go swim in it...beautiful to behold and lush gardens.
Dislikes - it's very cold water and there were lots of black fish swimming with you.
WOW!!!!. All i can say is this trip is a must. It is incredible and well worth the money. The temples were so impressive.

Brilliant Trip to Chikin Ha. We booked our visit to the Chikin-Ha cenote and Akumal beach snorkelling with turtles during our stay at Playa del Carmen. This was a fantastic half day trip taking in Akumal (tortuga bay) and Chikin-Ha cenote which are located close to Playa del Carmen. Our tour guide Giovanni was great and spoke good English, the cenotes were outstanding, water was crystal clear and quite cold, and the photographer was great. Didn't think much of the lunch (empanadas and banana cake) but overall this was a great experience and superb value for money.

having 3 attractions altogether was great!. We were able to havr lunch here, prepared by Mayan natives, which was amazing in itself. The fruits were delightful and the avocado delicious. They even had hibiscus flower juice which we enjoyed especially as we ate them as children. There was ziplining, both a short one and a longer one, over the water. Then kayaking, which was lots of fun, including crashing into the embankment and eachother now and then. We even went into a small cave like area, very nice. Heading back to the end was like the amazing race :) was alot of fun. Ended with swimming in the cenotes, water was crystal clear and very cool, there was even a jumping platform. And for those just wanting to relax, there were some hammocks, looked heavenly. All in all a wonderful experience and so convenient to have all these activities in one place, makee it easy.

Great cenote for family. We wanted to visit a cenote and do some beach snorkeling in the same day. This was perfect. Akumal (tortuga bay) snorkeling and Chikin Ha cenotes are close enough to Playa del Carmen and to one another to do them in less than a full day. Yes, there are probably better, more amazing cenotes, but we had a great guide (Lada, and adorable russian with near-perfect english) and the cenotes were very neat, water was clear and cool, and the photographer (Gonza) was excellent (CD with all pics, no videos, was $25 US). Whether or not you are there with a group, try an empanada, they are fabulous!

Beautiful natural pools. It's a little secluded and under construction some of it but it is a very unique scenery , never seen under water natural spring water pools before, great price $30, the staff can't be more cordial and helpful
Nice place. The beauty of this place is incredible! The water is very cold and to get in the water and get out of it, there is only 2 small wooden staircases...not the best...
loved it. travel time sucked, but it is a must see!!! The staff made this tour great. I would say it is a great place to see.

Enjoyed- peaceful and beautiful. Went at a quiet time in the afternoon; had the caves to ourselves other than a few scuba divers. Pretty pools with lots of little fish in the first pool. A magical place. Take your snorkel gear to see better under the water.

Excellent Cave Diving!. 3/23/14 - Incredible first dive of the day. Easy entry over stepped rocks into the crystal clear waters of the Chikin Ha Cenote system. Dive over boulders in the cavern zone for ten minutes before reaching the tie in for the cave section. Beautiful shafts of light piecring the light-green algae covered surface. After a 100foot jump on a reel over to the main line of the cave, which went from florida gold line to Danny Riordin's braided nylon. the delicate sculpted and scalloped limestone was so delicate, that even our bubble brought down a light rain of small rocks. Tiny albino shrimp, smaller than a grain of rice, were caught in our cave lights as we pushed through the dark passages. The field of limeston, sculpted by years of acidic water from above, often looked like fields of bones. Finning was careful through these sections, but they always seemed to open up into larger rooms. Well, until they didn't - we turned at ~52 minutes in not on thirds (my SAC rate was ~.55 on the entire dice) but due to a combination of new silt, calcium silt, and limestone dropping from above. On exit a large rock, perhaps 3ft wide, broke loose and struck my legs as we passed. Could have found the line faster, but situation was handled well. Good thing it didn't whack Juan's head - I was leading out. On the way out the Halocline (layers of water separated by salt and fresh water) were far clearer as I was leading the dive instead of following. We ran about five minutes faster out due to my longer legs and the slight flow that pushed us gently out of the cave. Decompression in an open area of the basin afforded us the ability to watch the snorklers puddling above us and tour divers following the cavern line. We both surfaced at 111 minutes, smiling and laughing and agreeing that this had been an enjoyable day. Can't wait for tomorrow.

Group tour. Came here as part of Ocean Tours Turtles and cenotes excursion. We were able to swim/snorkel in 2 of the cenotes, the 3rd one being smaller but used for religious events. Food we were provided with was very good. Washrooms very clean .

Another great day. We combined a snorkel trip to the cenotes and to akumel to snorkel with the sea turtles. Great day. You can not use sunscreen because it is dangerous to the shells of the turtles. Bring a t shirt. The cenotes are beautiful fresh water. It is a great trip for beginning snorkelers like my daughter. The water is calm and clear.
Enjoyable visit. A unique experience being able to snorkel inside caves and share the history of the site; delicious snack too at end of visit.
Amazing. The best visibility ever. Unique scubadiving experience. Will be back soon hopefully... Another world
Cenote spectacular. WOW is all I can say if you have never been its an erie mix of wonder and amazement almost sacred as you will be swimming in the waters of thousands of years
Great diving. Loved diving here. Strongly recommended or divers of all levels of experience. Dove here with CenoteXperience.

Somewhere Under The Rainbow. Chikin Ha is so colorful. It is named the rainbow cenote for a reason. While under water, you see all the colors of the rainbow up above. We have dived a lot of cenotes, and this one is my favorite because of all the colors and the lights.

Very special cenote. Cenotes are privately owned by citizen's . This one was handed down to a Grandson in his 20's. He has made this place a magical wonderland for himself and his staff. They are all like family and its very nice. We hung out with a young fellow named Sebastien ,who was just adorable. He showed us around the cenote & took me over to the sweat lodge. It is used in Mayan rituals on full moon's they use special leaves & bark to burn the rocks that heat the lodge. The leaves & wood have a very distinct aromatic smell that is memorable.After you steam at night on the full moon you can cool down in the cenote. They have a shaman at this paticular cenote & a special cenote just for his ceremony's. You won't find this at any of the 6 or so one's I visited. The place is a very short cab ride down a dirt road across from the main town in Playa. You can swim here, snorkel or have a shaman fix you up. Each cenote has there own vibe this one is very close to my heart.
Scuba diving. One of our two main reasons for visiting Playa del Carmen was scuba diving in the Cenotes, and we did them all. It was a sensational good experience.
3 cenotes in nice jungles. nothing amazing compairing to Chchen Itza cenote but not a bad place if not counting chilly water :), better on a sunny day than cloudy. it looks prettier under the water.
A must visit. A great place to visit, it is a must. No dislikes. You need to book this trip with your holiday rep, as ours with Thomson included a swim in the underground cave plus lunch.

Beautiful and fun!. The Cenote at Chichen Itza was so pretty. The water is kinda cold and deep, but I think it is so neat to know that you can swim in the same water as the ancient Mayans. The history of the Cenotes are really interesting as well. The cenote at Chichen Itza has a cliff where you can dive into the water. There are life jackets that you can rent for three dollars, but my husband and I chose to just swim without one, and it was fine. There are a lot of vines hanging in the water, and you aren't allowed to touch them, so you can preserve the cenote, but it was pretty awesome.

Nice and clean!! Very Expencive Tequila and Gifts!!. Very nice to see the place but the prices are very expensive!! Especially the Tequila and there is a Misunderstanding when our agent told us that that will be tequila Factory but it came that is Tequila Shop!!
Great dive!. We were fortunate during our visit to this Cenote, and there were no divers outside of my husband and myself, and our dive guide. It was beautiful, we loved our time there.

The most beautiful cenotes I've seen so far. It was my first visit to Mexico and I have visited a lot of cenotes during my stay, but the nicest ones were those of Chikin-Ha. When I was there with Ocean Tours, we were the only people around, so the atmosphere was very peaceful and quiet. It's very special to go snorkling in the half-open cenote, to visit the underground one, and to snorkle in the open cenote where you might find some terrapins. Really a place to relax and to enjoy nature!
deep down swimming. Great facility; music playing, excellent dressing rooms and a great swim way down in the sink hole. If in the area don't miss it even just to watch the divers & swimmers

Interesting. We visited and saw the cenote and mayan purification ritual as part of a tour. We didn't have time to swim but the cenote looked lovely - you could see some fish through the clear water.The Mayan purification ritual was interesting to observe. They took your picture with the priest which you could buy afterwards - a nice momento but quite expensive at $20.Would advise using mosquito repellant!

Beautiful surroundings and a great learning experience. We learned so much on this tour-and it was breathtakingly beautiful. Highly recommended! My husband was not feeling well-so it was just my daughter and I who went. We both enjoyed it-and would go again on our next visit.

a piece of paradise. Haven´t been to other cenotes in the area but visiting Mexico without seeing this paradise on Earth is just not worth! The flora ist breathtaking and swimming with turtles in the cool water is unforgettable. Grab one of the colectivo-vans operating between Tulum and Playa, walk abt 20mins through a forrest full of various butterflies, tarrantulas etc. or simply rent a bike to get there. You won´t regret!
Lots of fun. We all have fun there, it does not cost too much to get in. lots of little fish in the Cenote, they nibbles on your feet.

First cavern dives. Great first cavern dive with Mikes. For qualified divers this is a must. It is a short walk from the car park to the easy entry points. It is good dance from the entry point to the exits, so a real cavern experience.
Beautiful cool waters. Saw a bat and a turtle, please see main review though, please remember to spray with insect repellent beforehand. Simply a must was beautiful.
Tourist trap. Scenery ok but was a tourist trap. Lots of shopping there and the natural beauty was nice. The swim wasn't worth the trip.

breathtaking.!!. Seeing the Chitzen Itza and learning about the history of the Mayan and Aztec was amazing. our tour guide named Alfonso from the Sun travel, located at the Ocean Maya Royale resort was awesome.
Amazing. This place is so beautiful and we got to swim with turtles in the crystal clear cenotes!! well worth a visit but make sure you wear mosquito spray!!!!!!!!
Must see. Very interesting and had a GREAT tour guide. It was hot and a lot of walking and stairs but well worth it. We actually wen in May but the date on this site didn't go back that far.

a must do!. Fabulous snorkeling, the water is refreshingly cool and exploring the cavern and its pass ways via snorkeling is just amazing. Spotted plenty of turtles too. I recommend this place for an afternoon.

Underground water hole CENOTE. An adventure to experience the underground fresh water hole called a Cenote there are many around Mexico where the Limestone has cracked and over many hundreds of years made these amazing places. You have a life jacket and snorkle and float around in the clear fresh water looking at what's beneath. Beware of mosquitos which are in their masses and will bite. Take a camera and money for souvenirs.

great cenote. this cenote park has several areas- bring bug spay! lots of mosquitos- really picturesque and wont take up your whole day- I like diving and snorkeling cenote so we really enjoyed the easy access and choices this small park has
